src:
China Luncurkan Jaringan 5G Terbesar, Pengguna Masih Gusar
04 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Iklan jaringan 5G di China. Foto: Reuters

Beijing - China telah menggelar komersialisasi jaringan 5G yang disebut terbesar di dunia, mengingat wilayah dan penduduknya yang masif. Namun demikian, belum semua senang dengan implementasi jaringan super ngebut tersebut.Operator China Unicom, China Telecom dan China Mobile telah serentak menggelar layanan 5G, dengan ratusan ribu BTS 5G telah didirikan, termasuk 10 ribu unit di ibu kota Beijing.Namun demikian, beberapa konsumen masih gusar terkait kecepatan dan harga. Dengan download tembus 1 Gbps, jaringan 5G digadang-gadang akan mengakselerasi mobil otomatis dan lain-lain. Namun saat ini, kecepatannya belum sesuai angan-angan."Coverage 5G sudah cukup luas di kota Zhengzhou, namun tidak sengebut yang saya perkirakan," kata seorang pengguna, dikutip detikINET dari South China Morning Post.Isu lain adalah harga. Layanan 5G dengan kuota 30 GB harganya USD 18 per bulan yang disebut lebih mahal dari sebelumnya. Belum lagi untuk dapat menikmati 5G, ponselnya harus kompatibel dan banderol saat ini masih tinggi.Memang baru ada segelintir ponsel 5G yang beredar di China. Namun tentu nantinya akan lebih murah meski masih butuh waktu lama."Ponsel 5G mahal terutama karena komponennya tidak murah, hak properti intelektual dam pengembangannya. Akan turun tahun depan, tapi sedikitnya butuh waktu sampai tahun 2022 untuk mencapai level yang sama dengan ponsel 4G," cetus Zahid Ghadialy, analis di 3G4G.Simak Video "Nggak Cuma Boyong Teknologi, Huawei Juga Transfer Ilmu Soal 5G"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fyk/rns)
text:
China Launches the Biggest 5G Network, Users Are Still Upset
04 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


5G ad network in China. Photo: Reuters

Beijing - China has held commercialization of the so-called largest 5G network in the world, given its massive region and population. However, not all are happy with the implementation of the super speeding network. China Unicom operators, China Telecom and China Mobile have simultaneously held 5G services, with hundreds of thousands of 5G BTS already established, including 10,000 units in the capital city of Beijing. However, some consumers still upset about the speed and price. With a download of 1 Gbps, the 5G network is predicted to accelerate the automatic car and so on. But at this time, the speed is not in line with expectations. "Coverage 5G is quite extensive in the city of Zhengzhou, but not as fierce as I expected," said a user, quoted from South China Morning Post. Another issue is price. A 5G service with a 30GB quota costs USD 18 per month which is said to be more expensive than before. Not to mention to be able to enjoy 5G, the cellphone must be compatible and the current official price is still high. Indeed, there are only a handful of 5G phones circulating in China. But of course it will be cheaper even though it still takes a long time. "5G phones are expensive especially because the components are not cheap, intellectual property rights and development. It will go down next year, but at least it takes until 2022 to reach the same level as 4G phones," said Zahid Ghadialy, analyst at 3G4G. Watch Video "Not Only Technology, Huawei Also Transfer 5G Problem Science" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (fyk / rns)
